trans-unit.source: Steps to failback from Azure to VMware
trans-unit.target: Steps to failback from Azure to VMware

trans-unit.source: This article describes how Azure Site Recovery and vContinuum tool can be used to failback a virtual machine back to VMware.
trans-unit.target: This article describes how Azure Site Recovery and vContinuum tool can be used to failback a virtual machine back to VMware.

trans-unit.source: Steps to failback from Azure to VMware
trans-unit.target: Steps to failback from Azure to VMware

trans-unit.source: This document will walk you through the steps you need to failback from Azure back to your VMware site.
trans-unit.target: This document will walk you through the steps you need to failback from Azure back to your VMware site.

trans-unit.source: You must have already followed the steps given in the tutorial for <link><linkText>VMware to Azure protection and recovery</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: You must have already followed the steps given in the tutorial for <link><linkText>VMware to Azure protection and recovery</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: After a successful failover to Azure, the virtual machines will be
trans-unit.target: After a successful failover to Azure, the virtual machines will be

trans-unit.source: available in the virtual machines tab.
trans-unit.target: available in the virtual machines tab.

trans-unit.source: When you decide to failback –
trans-unit.target: When you decide to failback –

trans-unit.source: below are the steps you need to follow.
trans-unit.target: below are the steps you need to follow.

trans-unit.source: Note that when you failback from Azure back to your VMware site, the recovery can only be to a virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Note that when you failback from Azure back to your VMware site, the recovery can only be to a virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Even if your initial source on VMware was a physical machine, failover to Azure followed by a failback to VMware will convert it into a virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Even if your initial source on VMware was a physical machine, failover to Azure followed by a failback to VMware will convert it into a virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.target: Install vContinuum server on-premises

trans-unit.source: a.
trans-unit.target: a.

trans-unit.target: Configure it to point to the CS

trans-unit.target: Deploy a PS on Azure

trans-unit.target: Install a MT on-premises

trans-unit.target: Steps to protect the failed over VMs back to on-premises

trans-unit.target: a.

trans-unit.target: Configuration considerations

trans-unit.target: Monitoring protection of VMs back to on-premises

trans-unit.source: Failover the VMs back to on-premises
trans-unit.target: Failover the VMs back to on-premises

trans-unit.source: Below is the setup overview that we will achieve with the below steps.
trans-unit.target: Below is the setup overview that we will achieve with the below steps.

trans-unit.source: Part of the setup has already been completed during failover.
trans-unit.target: Part of the setup has already been completed during failover.

trans-unit.source: The blue lines are the connections used during failover.
trans-unit.target: The blue lines are the connections used during failover.

trans-unit.source: The red lines are the connections used during failback.
trans-unit.target: The red lines are the connections used during failback.

trans-unit.source: The lines with arrows go over the internet.
trans-unit.target: The lines with arrows go over the internet.

trans-unit.source: Install vContinuum on-premsies
trans-unit.target: Install vContinuum on-premsies

trans-unit.source: The vContinuum setup will be at available at <link><linkText>download location</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: The vContinuum setup will be at available at <link><linkText>download location</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: In addition install the patch given here on the vContinuum - available at <link><linkText>download location</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: In addition install the patch given here on the vContinuum - available at <link><linkText>download location</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Launch the setup to begin installation of vContinuum.
trans-unit.target: Launch the setup to begin installation of vContinuum.

trans-unit.source: Click Next.
trans-unit.target: Click Next.

trans-unit.source: Specify the CX server IP address and the CX server port.
trans-unit.target: Specify the CX server IP address and the CX server port.

trans-unit.source: Select HTTPS.
trans-unit.target: Select HTTPS.

trans-unit.source: To discover the CX IP address go to the CS deployment on Azure and view its dashboard.
trans-unit.target: To discover the CX IP address go to the CS deployment on Azure and view its dashboard.

trans-unit.source: To discover the CX public port go to the endpoints tab in the VM page and identify the HTTPs endpoints public port.
trans-unit.target: To discover the CX public port go to the endpoints tab in the VM page and identify the HTTPs endpoints public port.

trans-unit.source: Specify the CS Passphrase.
trans-unit.target: Specify the CS Passphrase.

trans-unit.source: You need to have noted down the passphrase during the CS registration.
trans-unit.target: You need to have noted down the passphrase during the CS registration.

trans-unit.source: You would have used the passphrase during MT and PS deployments also.
trans-unit.target: You would have used the passphrase during MT and PS deployments also.

trans-unit.source: In case you do not remember the passphrase you can go in to the CS server on Azure and find the passphrase stored under C:\\Program Files (x86)\\InMage Systems\\private\\connection.passphrase
trans-unit.target: In case you do not remember the passphrase you can go in to the CS server on Azure and find the passphrase stored under C:\\Program Files (x86)\\InMage Systems\\private\\connection.passphrase

trans-unit.source: Specify the location to install the vContinuum server and begin installation.
trans-unit.target: Specify the location to install the vContinuum server and begin installation.

trans-unit.source: Once you see that installation completes, you can launch the vContinuum to see it working.
trans-unit.target: Once you see that installation completes, you can launch the vContinuum to see it working.

trans-unit.source: Install PS server on Azure
trans-unit.target: Install PS server on Azure

trans-unit.source: A Process Server needs to be installed on Azure so that the VMs in Azure can send the data back to on-premises MT.
trans-unit.target: A Process Server needs to be installed on Azure so that the VMs in Azure can send the data back to on-premises MT.

trans-unit.source: You need to deploy the PS on Azure in the same network as the Configuration Server.
trans-unit.target: You need to deploy the PS on Azure in the same network as the Configuration Server.

trans-unit.source: On the Configuration Servers page in Azure, select to add a new process server.
trans-unit.target: On the Configuration Servers page in Azure, select to add a new process server.

trans-unit.source: Specify a process server name, and enter a name and password to connect to the virtual machine as an admin.
trans-unit.target: Specify a process server name, and enter a name and password to connect to the virtual machine as an admin.

trans-unit.source: Select the configuration server to which you're registering the process server.
trans-unit.target: Select the configuration server to which you're registering the process server.

trans-unit.source: This should be the same server you're using to protect and fail over your virtual machines.
trans-unit.target: This should be the same server you're using to protect and fail over your virtual machines.

trans-unit.source: Specify the Azure ntwork in which the process server should be deployment.
trans-unit.target: Specify the Azure ntwork in which the process server should be deployment.

trans-unit.source: It should be the same network as the configuration server.
trans-unit.target: It should be the same network as the configuration server.

trans-unit.source: Specify a unique IP address from the select subnet and begin deployment.
trans-unit.target: Specify a unique IP address from the select subnet and begin deployment.

trans-unit.source: A job to deploy the process server will be triggered.
trans-unit.target: A job to deploy the process server will be triggered.

trans-unit.source: Once the process server is deployed on Azure you can log into the server
trans-unit.target: Once the process server is deployed on Azure you can log into the server

trans-unit.source: using the credentials you specified.
trans-unit.target: using the credentials you specified.

trans-unit.source: Use the same steps you used during
trans-unit.target: Use the same steps you used during

trans-unit.source: forward direction of protection to register the PS.
trans-unit.target: forward direction of protection to register the PS.

trans-unit.source: The servers registered during failback will not be visible under VM properties.
trans-unit.target: The servers registered during failback will not be visible under VM properties.

trans-unit.source: They will be only visible under the Servers tab under the Configuration server to which they have been registered.
trans-unit.target: They will be only visible under the Servers tab under the Configuration server to which they have been registered.

trans-unit.source: It can take about 10-15 mins for the PS to be listed under the CS.
trans-unit.target: It can take about 10-15 mins for the PS to be listed under the CS.

trans-unit.source: Install an MT server on-premises
trans-unit.target: Install an MT server on-premises

trans-unit.source: Depending on the source side virtual machines you need to install a Linux or a Windows Master Target server on-premises.
trans-unit.target: Depending on the source side virtual machines you need to install a Linux or a Windows Master Target server on-premises.

trans-unit.source: Deploy Windows MT
trans-unit.target: Deploy Windows MT

trans-unit.source: A windows MT is already bundled with vContinuum setup.
trans-unit.target: A windows MT is already bundled with vContinuum setup.

trans-unit.source: When you install
trans-unit.target: When you install

trans-unit.source: the vContinuum, an MT is also deployed on the same machine and
trans-unit.target: the vContinuum, an MT is also deployed on the same machine and

trans-unit.source: registered to the Configuration server.
trans-unit.target: registered to the Configuration server.

trans-unit.source: To begin deployment, create an empty machine on-premises on the ESX
trans-unit.target: To begin deployment, create an empty machine on-premises on the ESX

trans-unit.source: host onto which you want to recover the VMs from Auzre.
trans-unit.target: host onto which you want to recover the VMs from Auzre.

trans-unit.source: Ensure that there are at least two disks attached to the VM – one is
trans-unit.target: Ensure that there are at least two disks attached to the VM – one is

trans-unit.source: used for the OS and the second one is used for Retention Drive.
trans-unit.target: used for the OS and the second one is used for Retention Drive.

trans-unit.source: Install the operating system.
trans-unit.target: Install the operating system.

trans-unit.source: Install the vContinuum on the server.
trans-unit.target: Install the vContinuum on the server.

trans-unit.source: This would also complete
trans-unit.target: This would also complete

trans-unit.source: installation of the MT.
trans-unit.target: installation of the MT.

trans-unit.source: Deploy Linux MT
trans-unit.target: Deploy Linux MT

trans-unit.source: To begin deployment, create an empty machine on-premises on the ESX
trans-unit.target: To begin deployment, create an empty machine on-premises on the ESX

trans-unit.source: host onto which you want to recover the VMs from Auzre.
trans-unit.target: host onto which you want to recover the VMs from Auzre.

trans-unit.source: Ensure that there are at least two disks attached to the VM – one is
trans-unit.target: Ensure that there are at least two disks attached to the VM – one is

trans-unit.source: used for the OS and the second one is used for Retention Drive.
trans-unit.target: used for the OS and the second one is used for Retention Drive.

trans-unit.source: Install the linux operating system.
trans-unit.target: Install the linux operating system.

trans-unit.source: NLinux Master Target (MT) system should not use LVM for root or retention storage spaces.
trans-unit.target: NLinux Master Target (MT) system should not use LVM for root or retention storage spaces.

trans-unit.source: Linux MT configured to avoid LVM partitions/disks discovery by default.
trans-unit.target: Linux MT configured to avoid LVM partitions/disks discovery by default.

trans-unit.source: Partitions that you can create are
trans-unit.target: Partitions that you can create are

trans-unit.source: Carry out the below post installation steps before beginning MT installation.
trans-unit.target: Carry out the below post installation steps before beginning MT installation.

trans-unit.source: Post OS Installation Steps
trans-unit.target: Post OS Installation Steps

trans-unit.source: To get SCSI ID’s for each of SCSI hard disk in a Linux virtual machine,
trans-unit.target: To get SCSI ID’s for each of SCSI hard disk in a Linux virtual machine,

trans-unit.source: you should enable the parameter “disk.EnableUUID = TRUE”.
trans-unit.target: you should enable the parameter “disk.EnableUUID = TRUE”.

trans-unit.source: To enable this parameter, follow the steps as given below:
trans-unit.target: To enable this parameter, follow the steps as given below:

trans-unit.source: Shut down your virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Shut down your virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Right-click the VM’s entry in the left-hand panel > Edit Settings.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the VM’s entry in the left-hand panel > Edit Settings.

trans-unit.source: Click the Options tab.
trans-unit.target: Click the Options tab.

trans-unit.source: Select the Advanced\>General item on the left and click the Configuration Parameters that you see on the right.
trans-unit.target: Select the Advanced\>General item on the left and click the Configuration Parameters that you see on the right.

trans-unit.source: “Configuration Parameters” option will be in de-active state when the machine is running”.
trans-unit.target: “Configuration Parameters” option will be in de-active state when the machine is running”.

trans-unit.source: In order to make this tab active, shutdown machine.
trans-unit.target: In order to make this tab active, shutdown machine.

trans-unit.source: See whether already a row with disk.EnableUUID exists?
trans-unit.target: See whether already a row with disk.EnableUUID exists?

trans-unit.source: If exists and if the value is set to False over write the value with True (True and False values are case in-sensitive).
trans-unit.target: If exists and if the value is set to False over write the value with True (True and False values are case in-sensitive).

trans-unit.source: If exists and is set to true, click on cancel and test the SCSI command inside guest operating system after it is boot-up.
trans-unit.target: If exists and is set to true, click on cancel and test the SCSI command inside guest operating system after it is boot-up.

trans-unit.source: If does not exist click Add Row.
trans-unit.target: If does not exist click Add Row.

trans-unit.source: Add disk.EnableUUID in the Name column.
trans-unit.target: Add disk.EnableUUID in the Name column.

trans-unit.source: Set its value as TRUE.
trans-unit.target: Set its value as TRUE.

trans-unit.source: Do not add the above values along with double-quotes.
trans-unit.target: Do not add the above values along with double-quotes.

trans-unit.source: Download and Install the Additional Packages
trans-unit.target: Download and Install the Additional Packages

trans-unit.source: NOTE: Make sure system has Internet connectivity before download and
trans-unit.target: NOTE: Make sure system has Internet connectivity before download and

trans-unit.source: installing additional packages.
trans-unit.target: installing additional packages.

trans-unit.source: \# yum install -y xfsprogs perl lsscsi rsync wget kexec-tools
trans-unit.target: \# yum install -y xfsprogs perl lsscsi rsync wget kexec-tools

trans-unit.source: Above command will download below mentioned 15 packages from CentOS 6.6
trans-unit.target: Above command will download below mentioned 15 packages from CentOS 6.6

trans-unit.source: repository and install.
trans-unit.target: repository and install.

trans-unit.source: elfutils-libs-0.158-3.2.el6.x86\_64.rpm
trans-unit.target: elfutils-libs-0.158-3.2.el6.x86\_64.rpm

trans-unit.source: kexec-tools-2.0.0-280.el6.x86\_64.rpm
trans-unit.target: kexec-tools-2.0.0-280.el6.x86\_64.rpm

trans-unit.source: lsscsi-0.23-2.el6.x86\_64.rpm
trans-unit.target: lsscsi-0.23-2.el6.x86\_64.rpm

trans-unit.source: perl-Module-Pluggable-3.90-136.el6\_6.1.x86\_64.rpm
trans-unit.target: perl-Module-Pluggable-3.90-136.el6\_6.1.x86\_64.rpm

trans-unit.source: perl-Pod-Escapes-1.04-136.el6\_6.1.x86\_64.rpm
trans-unit.target: perl-Pod-Escapes-1.04-136.el6\_6.1.x86\_64.rpm

trans-unit.target: perl-Pod-Simple-3.13-136.el6\_6.1.x86\_64.rpm

trans-unit.target: perl-version-0.77-136.el6\_6.1.x86\_64.rpm

trans-unit.source: snappy-1.1.0-1.el6.x86\_64.rpm
trans-unit.target: snappy-1.1.0-1.el6.x86\_64.rpm

trans-unit.source: NOTE: If source machine uses Reiser or XFS filesystem for root or boot
trans-unit.target: NOTE: If source machine uses Reiser or XFS filesystem for root or boot

trans-unit.source: device, then following packages should be download and installed on
trans-unit.target: device, then following packages should be download and installed on

trans-unit.source: Linux Master Target prior to the protection.
trans-unit.target: Linux Master Target prior to the protection.

trans-unit.source: \# cd /usr/local
trans-unit.target: \# cd /usr/local

trans-unit.source: \# wget
trans-unit.target: \# wget

trans-unit.source: \# wget
trans-unit.target: \# wget

trans-unit.source: \# rpm -ivh kmod-reiserfs-0.0-1.el6.elrepo.x86\_64.rpm
trans-unit.target: \# rpm -ivh kmod-reiserfs-0.0-1.el6.elrepo.x86\_64.rpm

trans-unit.source: reiserfs-utils-3.6.21-1.el6.elrepo.x86\_64.rpm
trans-unit.target: reiserfs-utils-3.6.21-1.el6.elrepo.x86\_64.rpm

trans-unit.source: \# wget
trans-unit.target: \# wget

trans-unit.target: \# rpm -ivh xfsprogs-3.1.1-16.el6.x86\_64.rpm

trans-unit.source: Apply Custom Configuration Changes
trans-unit.target: Apply Custom Configuration Changes

trans-unit.source: Before applying custom configuration changes make sure you have
trans-unit.target: Before applying custom configuration changes make sure you have

trans-unit.source: completed Post Installation Steps
trans-unit.target: completed Post Installation Steps

trans-unit.source: To apply custom configuration changes, follow the below mentioned steps:
trans-unit.target: To apply custom configuration changes, follow the below mentioned steps:

trans-unit.source: Copy the RHEL 6-64 Unified Agent binary to the newly created OS.
trans-unit.target: Copy the RHEL 6-64 Unified Agent binary to the newly created OS.

trans-unit.source: Run the below command to untar the binary.
trans-unit.target: Run the below command to untar the binary.

trans-unit.source: **tar -zxvf \<html></html>**
trans-unit.target: **tar -zxvf \<html></html>**

trans-unit.source: Execute below command to give permission.
trans-unit.target: Execute below command to give permission.

trans-unit.source: \# chmod 755 ./ApplyCustomChanges.sh
trans-unit.target: \# chmod 755 ./ApplyCustomChanges.sh

trans-unit.source: Execute the below command to run the script.
trans-unit.target: Execute the below command to run the script.

trans-unit.source: \# ./ApplyCustomChanges.sh
trans-unit.target: \# ./ApplyCustomChanges.sh

trans-unit.source: NOTE: Execute the script only once on the server.
trans-unit.target: NOTE: Execute the script only once on the server.

trans-unit.source: REBOOT the server
trans-unit.target: REBOOT the server

trans-unit.source: after successful execution of the above script.
trans-unit.target: after successful execution of the above script.

trans-unit.source: Begin MT Installation
trans-unit.target: Begin MT Installation

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Download</linkText><title></title></link> the Linux
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Download</linkText><title></title></link> the Linux

trans-unit.target: Master Target Server installation file.

trans-unit.source: Copy the downloaded Linux Master Target Server installer to the Linux
trans-unit.target: Copy the downloaded Linux Master Target Server installer to the Linux

trans-unit.source: Master Target virtual machine using an sftp client utility of your
trans-unit.target: Master Target virtual machine using an sftp client utility of your

trans-unit.source: choice.
trans-unit.target: choice.

trans-unit.source: Alternately you can log into the Linux Master Target virtual
trans-unit.target: Alternately you can log into the Linux Master Target virtual

trans-unit.source: machine and use wget to download the installation package from the
trans-unit.target: machine and use wget to download the installation package from the

trans-unit.source: provided link.
trans-unit.target: provided link.

trans-unit.source: Log in to the Linux Master Target server virtual machine using an ssh
trans-unit.target: Log in to the Linux Master Target server virtual machine using an ssh

trans-unit.source: client of your choice.
trans-unit.target: client of your choice.

trans-unit.source: If you are connected to the Azure network on which you deployed your
trans-unit.target: If you are connected to the Azure network on which you deployed your

trans-unit.source: Linux Master Target server through a VPN connection then use the
trans-unit.target: Linux Master Target server through a VPN connection then use the

trans-unit.target: internal IP address for the Linux Master Target Server obtained from the

trans-unit.target: virtual machine dashboard and port 22 to connect to the Linux Master

trans-unit.target: Target Server using Secure Shell.

trans-unit.source: If you are connecting to the Linux Master Target Server over a public
trans-unit.target: If you are connecting to the Linux Master Target Server over a public

trans-unit.source: internet connection use the Linux Master Target Server’s public virtual
trans-unit.target: internet connection use the Linux Master Target Server’s public virtual

trans-unit.source: IP address (from the virtual machines dashboard page) and the public
trans-unit.target: IP address (from the virtual machines dashboard page) and the public

trans-unit.source: endpoint created for ssh to login to the Linux Master Target Server.
trans-unit.target: endpoint created for ssh to login to the Linux Master Target Server.

trans-unit.source: Extract the files from the gzipped Linux Master Target Server installer
trans-unit.target: Extract the files from the gzipped Linux Master Target Server installer

trans-unit.source: tar archive by executing
trans-unit.target: tar archive by executing

trans-unit.source: “tar –xvzf Microsoft-ASR\_UA\_8.2.0.0\_RHEL6-64\”* from the directory
trans-unit.target: “tar –xvzf Microsoft-ASR\_UA\_8.2.0.0\_RHEL6-64\”* from the directory

trans-unit.source: where you had copied the Linux Master Target Server installer to.
trans-unit.target: where you had copied the Linux Master Target Server installer to.

trans-unit.source: If you extracted the installer files to a different directory change
trans-unit.target: If you extracted the installer files to a different directory change

trans-unit.source: directory to the directory to which the contents of the tar archive were
trans-unit.target: directory to the directory to which the contents of the tar archive were

trans-unit.source: extracted.
trans-unit.target: extracted.

trans-unit.source: From this directory path execute “sudo ./install.sh”
trans-unit.target: From this directory path execute “sudo ./install.sh”

trans-unit.source: When prompted to make choice of Primary Role of this Agent select 2
trans-unit.target: When prompted to make choice of Primary Role of this Agent select 2

trans-unit.source: (Master Target)
trans-unit.target: (Master Target)

trans-unit.source: Leave the other interactive install options at their default values.
trans-unit.target: Leave the other interactive install options at their default values.

trans-unit.target: Wait for the rest of the installation to proceed and the Host Config

trans-unit.target: Interface to appear.

trans-unit.source: The Host Configuration utility for the Linux Master
trans-unit.target: The Host Configuration utility for the Linux Master

trans-unit.source: Target Server is a command line utility.
trans-unit.target: Target Server is a command line utility.

trans-unit.source: Don’t resize your ssh client
trans-unit.target: Don’t resize your ssh client

trans-unit.source: utility window.
trans-unit.target: utility window.

trans-unit.source: Use the arrow keys to select the Global option and press
trans-unit.target: Use the arrow keys to select the Global option and press

trans-unit.source: enter on your keyboard.
trans-unit.target: enter on your keyboard.

trans-unit.source: Against the field IP enter the Internal IP address of the
trans-unit.target: Against the field IP enter the Internal IP address of the

trans-unit.source: Configuration Server obtained from the virtual machines dashboard
trans-unit.target: Configuration Server obtained from the virtual machines dashboard

trans-unit.source: page and press enter.
trans-unit.target: page and press enter.

trans-unit.source: Against the field Port enter 22 and press enter.
trans-unit.target: Against the field Port enter 22 and press enter.

trans-unit.source: Leave Use https: as Yes.
trans-unit.target: Leave Use https: as Yes.

trans-unit.source: Press enter one more time.
trans-unit.target: Press enter one more time.

trans-unit.source: Enter the Passphrase that was generated on the Configuration Server.
trans-unit.target: Enter the Passphrase that was generated on the Configuration Server.

trans-unit.source: If you are using PuTTY client from a Windows machine to ssh to the
trans-unit.target: If you are using PuTTY client from a Windows machine to ssh to the

trans-unit.target: Linux Master Target Server virtual machine you can use Shift+Insert

trans-unit.target: to paste the contents of the clipboard.

trans-unit.source: Copy the Passphrase to the
trans-unit.target: Copy the Passphrase to the

trans-unit.target: local clipboard using Ctrl-C and use Shift+Insert to paste it.

trans-unit.source: Press
trans-unit.target: Press

trans-unit.target: enter

trans-unit.target: Use the right arrow key to navigate to quit and press enter.

trans-unit.source: Wait for the installation to complete
trans-unit.target: Wait for the installation to complete

trans-unit.source: If for some reason you failed to register your Linux Master Target
trans-unit.target: If for some reason you failed to register your Linux Master Target

trans-unit.source: Server to the Configuration Server you could do so again by running the
trans-unit.target: Server to the Configuration Server you could do so again by running the

trans-unit.target: host configuration utility from /usr/local/ASR/Vx/bin/hostconfigcli (you

trans-unit.source: will first need to set access permissions to this directory by executing

trans-unit.source: Validate Master Target Server registration to the Configuration Server.
